articles.headline: Some Israelis Question Benefits for Ultra-Religious
articles.snippet: State welfare subsidies for full-time Torah study by ultra-Orthodox men have become the subject of a fierce debate.
articles.abstract: State welfare subsidies for full-time Torah study by ultra-Orthodox men have become the subject of a fierce debate.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM  Chaim Amsellem was certainly not the first Parliament member to suggest that most ultra-Orthodox men should work rather than receive welfare subsidies for full-time Torah study. But when he did so last month, the nation took notice: He is a rabbi, ultra-Orthodox himself, whose outspokenness ignited a fresh, and fierce, debate about the rapid growth of the ultra-religious in Israel.

articles.headline: Insurgents Set Aside Rivalries on Afghan Border
articles.snippet: Rival militant groups on both sides of the Afghanistan-Pakistan border are teaming up, military officials say.
articles.abstract: Rival militant groups on both sides of the Afghanistan-Pakistan border are teaming up, military officials say.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Rival militant organizations on both sides of the Afghanistan-Pakistan border have increasingly been teaming up in deadly raids, in what military and intelligence officials say is the insurgents’ latest attempt to regain the initiative after months of withering attacks from American and allied forces.

articles.headline: Europe’s Economic Pain Awakens Old Arguments
articles.snippet: Critics of the euro warned that the currency would be hobbled by different economic policies across Europe.
articles.abstract: Critics of the euro warned that the currency would be hobbled by different economic policies across Europe.

articles.headline: Wi-Fi Overload at High-Tech Meetings
articles.snippet: Technology conferences would seem to be a natural for great Wi-Fi access, but the technology was not intended for large rooms and crowds.
articles.abstract: Technology conferences would seem to be a natural for great Wi-Fi access, but the technology was not intended for large rooms and crowds.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Internet entrepreneurs climb on stage at technology conferences and praise a world in which everyone is perpetually connected to the Web.

articles.headline: In the Rearview, a Year That Fizzled
articles.snippet: This year, the economy started to recover, then sputtered. We look back at 2010 and look ahead, through charts.
articles.abstract: This year, the economy started to recover, then sputtered. We look back at 2010 and look ahead, through charts.

articles.headline: ‘Doubling Up’ in Recession-Strained Quarters
articles.snippet: The recession is causing a surge in households where relatives and friends live together as a last resort.
articles.abstract: The recession is causing a surge in households where relatives and friends live together as a last resort.
articles.lead_paragraph: FORT PIERCE, Fla.  For the three generations of the Maggi family crowded into a recession-beaten three-bedroom ranch house here, the tension from living on top of one another for the last 10 months sometimes erupts at unexpected moments.

articles.headline: In China, Car Buyers in a Backup
articles.snippet: One uncertainty in the global auto industry is how much longer Beijing will allow China’s remarkable sales boom to continue.
articles.abstract: One uncertainty in the global auto industry is how much longer Beijing will allow China’s remarkable sales boom to continue.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUANGZHOU, China  Li Bo, a 28-year-old lawyer, was one of three friends who put down deposits of 50,000 renminbi, or $7,500, in May at a car dealership to each buy a popular model, the Audi Q5, which sells for the equivalent of $72,000, including taxes, in China.
